title: Hash Tables
subject: Data Structures
theory:
A Hash Table uses an array of buckets. 
1. Compute Hash(key) % size.
2. Store (key, value) at that index.
Operations: Put/Get/Delete are avg O(1).

common_mistakes.correction: If key object changes and hashcode changes, you can't find it again. Use Strings/Integers as keys.

interview_questions.question: Worst case complexity of HashMap?
interview_questions.answer: O(n) if all keys collide to the same bucket (Hash collision).

summary: The most useful data structure in practical programming.
